statement:
Let $L$ be a first-order language and let $\mathcal{A}$ be an infinite
$L$-structure. Then if $\kappa$ is a cardinal with
$\kappa\geq\operatorname{Max}({\lvert \mathcal{A} \rvert}, {\lvert L \rvert})$
then there is an $L$-structure $\mathcal{B}$ such that
${\lvert \mathcal{B} \rvert} = \kappa$ and
$\mathcal{A} \preccurlyeq \mathcal{B}$.
